TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class ActiveDirectoryRole : System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole, IDisposable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ActiveDirectoryRole extends System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole implements class System.IDisposable, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Represents an Active Directory role in a Windows Workflow Foundation hosting environment. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Typically, the Active Directory store is used for storing organizational information for personnel. The main purpose for the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is for making queries against such organizational information for business reasons.
Active Directory roles typically correspond to a job function, title, or job skill within the context of the organization.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole GetAllReports() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an that contains all the roles that report to the current role either directly or indirectly.
Docs.returns: A that contains all the roles that either directly or indirectly report to the current role.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetAllReports%2A> returns all nodes below the current node. Use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetDirectReports%2A> to return only the nodes that are directly below the current node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole GetDirectReports() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an that contains all the roles that report directly to the current role.
Docs.returns: An that contains all the roles that directly report to the current role.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetDirectReports%2A> returns only the nodes that are directly below the current node. To return all nodes below the current node use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetAllReports%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry> GetEntries() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the generic collection that contains all objects associated with the current .
Docs.returns: The generic collection that is associated with the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A role can be a general collection of security objects. As such, a role can contain multiple identities, for example use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetEntries%2A> to return all directory objects associated with the role.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<string> GetIdentities() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a generic list of the Windows NT accounts associated with the .
Docs.returns: A generic list of values that represent the Windows NT accounts associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetIdentities%2A> obtains all <xref:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier> objects associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> and converts each of them into a string value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole GetManager() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an Active Directory role that contains information about the manager of the current .
Docs.returns: The that contains information about the manager of the current role.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetManager%2A> returns the direct manager for the current role. To return all roles above the current node, use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetManagerialChain%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole GetManagerialChain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the Active Directory role that contains information about the managerial chain associated with the current .
Docs.returns: The that contains information about the managerial chain associated with the current role.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetManagerialChain%2A> returns all nodes above the current role. To return just the direct manager of the current role, use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetManager%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole GetPeers() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an Active Directory role that contains information about all the directory operations that are supervised by the manager of the current .
Docs.returns: A that contains information about all directory operations that are supervised by the manager of the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> returned contains information from all objects managed by the manager of this role but does not contain this information from the current role.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier> GetSecurityIdentifiers() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a generic list of objects associated with the current .
Docs.returns: A generic list of objects associated with the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetSecurityIdentifiers%2A> checks each <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry> returned by the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetEntries%2A> method to see if the entry has a security identifier in its <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.Properties%2A> collection. If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry> has such a property, <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.GetSecurityIdentifiers%2A> adds a <xref:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier> to the list it returns.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IncludesIdentity(string identity) cil managed

Docs.param: The identity for which to search.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the contains the specified identity.
Docs.returns: to indicate that is included in the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because a role is a generalization of one or more objects, many identities may be described by a single role. Use <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.IncludesIdentity%2A> to test that a specified identity is included within this role.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Active Directory role name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the name to describe the role.

Docs.summary: Gets the root Active Directory node associated with the .
Docs.value: A that represents the root Active Directory node associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The root entry is the role up the chain of roles that has no manager.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.IDisposable.Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The implementation of <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole.System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData%2A> allows this object to be serialized.
